Additionally, the aspect can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 155,000 XP (310,000 XP total) for defeating the aspect of Bahamut after his Platinum Brilliance activates.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
traits.text: If the aspect fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

multiAttack.text: The aspect makes one Bite attack, one Claw attack, and one Tail attack.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (2d12 + 10) piercing damage plus 22 (4d10) force damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (2d10 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 20) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The aspect can have only one creature grappled this way at a time.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (2d12 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 27 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

special.name: Breath Weapon
special.description: The aspect uses one of the following breath weapons:

options.name: Exalting Breath
options.text: The aspect exhales the restoring winds of Mount Celestia in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area of the aspect's choice regains 71 (13d10) hit points, and each creature in that area of the aspect's choice that has been dead for no longer than 1 hour is restored to life with all its hit points.

options.name: Platinum Breath
options.text: The aspect exhales radiant platinum flames in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 26 Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 (12d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special.text: The aspect uses one of the following breath weapons:

bonusActions.name: Change Shape
bonusActions.text: The aspect magically transforms into any Humanoid or Beast, while retaining his game statistics (other than his size). This transformation ends if the aspect is reduced to 0 hit points or if he uses a bonus action to end it.

actions.name: Attack
actions.text: The aspect makes one Claw or Tail attack.

actions.name: Furious Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: The aspect makes one Bite attack. If the attack hits a creature, the target must succeed on a DC 27 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the aspect until the end of the target's next turn.

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Antimagic Aura
traits.text: Asmodeus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Spells of level 4 or lower can't damage Asmodeus.

traits.name: Fiendish Regeneration
traits.text: Asmodeus regains 40 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Asmodeus dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate. If Asmodeus dies, his body regenerates, returning to life 13 (2d12) days later.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Asmodeus fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Submission Aura
traits.text: When a creature moves to be within 120 feet of Asmodeus, they must succeed on a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw or have the frightened condition until they leave the aura. While frightened, creatures kneel before Asmodeus, taking no actions unless he commands otherwise. If Asmodeus deals damage to a kneeling creature, the creature's frightened condition ends. A creature that succeeds the saving throw is immune to this effect for 1 hour.

multiAttack.text: Asmodeus makes four attacks using Ruby Rod, Chilling Gaze, or a combination of the two. He can replace one of the attacks with Hellish Smite.

attacks.name: Ruby Rod
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +21 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (2d8 + 12) necrotic damage, which also reduces the target's hit point maximum by the damage taken. This damage can't reduce a target's hit point maximum below 1. Any effect that removes a disease allows a creature's hit point maximum to return to normal.

attacks.name: Chilling Gaze
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +16 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) cold damage, and the target has a-1 penalty to all attack rolls they make until the end of their next turn. This penalty can stack.

special.name: Hellish Smite
special.text: Asmodeus targets a creature he can see within 300 feet of him, calling down a bolt of hellish lightning. The target must make a DC 24 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) lightning damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special.name: Infernal Word: Stun
special.text: Asmodeus targets a creature he can see within 120 feet of him. The target must make a DC 24 Intelligence saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that failed the save is stunned for up to 1 minute. The stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success, but taking the damage again on a failed save.

special.name: Hell-Lord's Suggestion
special.text: Asmodeus targets a creature he can see within 120 feet of him. The target must make a DC 24 Charisma saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that failed the save has the charmed condition for up to 1 minute. While charmed, a creature is controlled by Asmodeus, performing only actions that he suggests. A charmed creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success, but taking the damage again on a failed save.

special.name: Fires of the Nine Hells
special.text: Asmodeus chooses a point he can see within 500 feet of him, which explodes into a roaring inferno. All creatures within a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 24 Dexterity saving throw, taking 70 (20d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Asmodeus casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 27): At will: Bane, Bestow Curse, Command, Cure Wounds, Darkness, Lesser Restoration, Remove Curse 1/day each: Antimagic Field, Earthquake, Flame Strike, Gate, Heal, Mass Heal, Wish

reactions.name: Ruby Absorption
reactions.text: As a reaction to being the sole target of a spell, Asmodeus can attempt to absorb the spell into the Ruby Rod.

actions.name: Channel Ruby Rod
actions.text: The Ruby Rod has 66 charges. Asmodeus may spend its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, with a spell save DC of 20: Lesser Restoration (3 charges), Wall of Force (7 charges), Greater Restoration (12 charges), Chain Lightning (15 charges), Prismatic Spray (23 charges), Globe of Invulnerability (33 charges)

actions.name: Strike (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Asmodeus makes a Ruby Rod attack.

actions.name: Call Underling (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: Asmodeus summons an allied pit fiend in an unoccupied space that he can see.

multiAttack.text: Sul Khatesh makes four attacks with Arcane Blast.

attacks.name: Arcane Blast
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +18 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (1d10 + 10) force damage.

attacks.name: Magic Staff
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (5d12 + 4) force damage.

special.name: Arcane Cataclysm (Recharges after a Long Rest)
special.text: Sul Khatesh conjures orbs of magical energy that plummet to the ground at three different points she can see within 1 mile of her. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point must make a DC 26 Dexterity saving throw, taking 71 (11d12) force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one arcane burst is affected only once. The area of each arcane burst then acts as an antimagic field for 1 hour. Sul Khatesh and spells she casts are unaffected by these fields.

special.name: Change Shape
special.text: Sul Khatesh magically polymorphs into a humanoid, beast, or giant that has a challenge rating no higher than her own, or back into her true form. She reverts to her true form if she dies. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (Sul Khatesh's choice). In a new form, Sul Khatesh retains her alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Her statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

actions.name: Attack
actions.text: Sul Khatesh makes two attacks with her Arcane Blast or one attack with her magic staff.

actions.name: Consume Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Sul Khatesh targets a creature within 120 feet of her who is concentrating on a spell. The target must succeed on a DC 26 Constitution saving throw or its concentration is broken on the spell, and Sul Khatesh gains 5 temporary hit points per level of that spell.

actions.name: Maddening Secrets (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: Sul Khatesh whispers an arcane secret into the mind of a creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target must succeed on a DC 26 Wisdom saving throw or expend one of its spell slots of 3rd level or lower and deal 26 (4d12) force damage to each creature within 30 feet of it. A creature that fails the saving throw but can't expend a spell slot is instead stunned until the end of its next turn.

Mammon's serpentine abilities can still recharge while he is in pit fiend form. If Mammon is already a pit fiend, this action changes him back into his serpentine form.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (6/Day)
traits.text: If the scion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The scion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The scion deals double damage to objects and structures.

multiAttack.text: The scion makes one Great Tree Club attack and two Slam attacks, or it makes three Boulder attacks.

attacks.name: Great Tree Club
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 23 Strength saving throw or be pushed horizontally up to 100 feet straight away from the scion and have the prone condition.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (4d8 + 8) force damage.

attacks.name: Boulder
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (3d12 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Inhale
special.text: The scion inhales a vortex of air in a 120-foot line that is 15 feet wide. Each creature in that area that is Huge or smaller must succeed on a DC 23 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 120 feet straight toward the scion and be swallowed. A swallowed creature has the restrained condition, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the scion, and takes 24 (7d6) force damage at the start of each of the scion's turns. The scion's stomach can hold up to two creatures at a time. If the scion takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the scion must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls in a space within 10 feet of the scion and has the prone condition. If the scion dies, any swallowed creature no longer has the restrained condition and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting with the prone condition.

bonusActions.name: Earth-Shaking Movement
bonusActions.text: The scion moves up to its speed and then sends a shock wave through the ground in a 60-foot-radius circle centered on itself. Each creature on the ground in that area that is concentrating must succeed on a DC 23 Constitution saving throw or lose concentration.

reactions.name: Feed
reactions.text: Immediately after taking damage, if it has at least one creature swallowed, the scion deals 10 (3d6) force damage to each swallowed creature and regains 10 hit points.

traits.text: If the incarnate fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The incarnate has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Planar Form
traits.text: An incarnate on the Upper Planes is a Celestial. An incarnate on the Lower Planes is a Fiend.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The incarnate deals double damage to objects and structures.

multiAttack.text: The incarnate makes two Slam or Energy Bolt attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (3d12 + 8) force damage.

attacks.name: Energy Bolt
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (5d12) necrotic damage if the incarnate is a Fiend or radiant damage if the incarnate is a Celestial.

special.name: Planar Exhalation
special.text: The incarnate exhales concentrated energy native to its plane in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 23 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 52 (8d12) necrotic damage if the incarnate is a Fiend or radiant damage if the incarnate is a Celestial, and the creature has the blinded condition until the end of the incarnate's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

reactions.name: Searing Gaze
reactions.text: In response to being hit by an attack roll, the incarnate turns its magical gaze toward one creature it can see within 120 feet of itself and commands it to combust. The target must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or take 16 (3d10) fire damage.

reactions.name: Teleport
reactions.text: Immediately after a creature the incarnate sees ends its turn, the incarnate teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

traits.name: Magic Resistance

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.text: Illmarrow's body turns to dust when she drops to 0 hit points, and her equipment is left behind. She gains a new body after 1d10 days, regaining all her hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within two hundred miles of the location at which she was destroyed.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.text: Illmarrow is a 20th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 23, +15 to hit with spell attacks). Illmarrow has the following wizard spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): chill touch (see "Actions" below), fire bolt, mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost 1st level (4 slots): magic missile, shield, sleep 2nd level (3 slots): blur, detect thoughts, mirror image 3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, counterspell, fireball, fly, lightning bolt 4th level (3 slots): blight, confusion, polymorph 5th level (3 slots): cloudkill, cone of cold, hold monster, scrying 6th level (2 slots): chain lightning, circle of death, create undead 7th level (2 slots): finger of death, forcecage, prismatic spray 8th level (1 slot): incendiary cloud, maze 9th level (1 slot): power word kill, time stop

attacks.name: Chill Touch (Cantrip)
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +15 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: 18 (4d8) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of Illmarrow's next turn. If the target is undead, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against Illmarrow until the end of her next turn.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

special.name: Poison Breath
special.text: Illmarrow exhales poisonous gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 35 (10d6) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the creature can't regain hit points. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned. A humanoid reduced to 0 hit points by this damage dies and rises at the start of Illmarrow's next turn as a zombie. The zombie acts immediately after Illmarrow in the initiative count and is permanently under her command, following her verbal orders.

actions.name: Cantrip
actions.text: Illmarrow casts a cantrip.

actions.name: Paralyzing Claw
actions.text: Illmarrow uses her Paralyzing Claw.

actions.name: Frightening Presence (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Illmarrow targets up to three creatures she can see within 30 feet of her. Each target must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to Illmarrow's Frightening Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Poison Breath (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: Illmarrow recharges her Poison Breath and uses it.

traits.text: If Jon Irenicus fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.text: If he has a phylactery and he is destroyed, Jon Irenicus gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all his hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.text: Jon Irenicus carries a rod of lordly might. He can use a bonus action to switch it between its Mace and Flame Tongue attacks.

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.text: Jon Irenicus has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

multiAttack.text: Jon Irenicus makes two Flame Tongue attacks or two Mace attacks. Each attack is made with advantage and does an additional 13 (2d12) force damage if it hits.

attacks.name: Flame Tongue (Rod of Lordly Might)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d8 + 7) slashing damage and 7 (2d6) fire damage.

attacks.name: Mace (Rod of Lordly Might)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Breath of Death (1/Day)
special.text: Jon Irenicus emits a 90-foot cone of necrotic energy. Each creature in the effects area must make a DC 21 saving throw, taking 55 (10d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, half as much damage on a successful one.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Jon Irenicus casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 21, +13 to hit with spell attacks): At will: Melf's acid arrow, detect magic, detect thoughts, invisibility, magic missile, mage hand, mirror image, prestidigitation, ray of frost, shield 2/day each: animate dead, dimension door, dispel magic, fireball, scrying 1/day each: disintegrate, dominate monster, finger of death, power word kill, power word stun, time stop

reactions.name: Draining Counterspell
reactions.text: Jon Irenicus interrupts a creature he can see that is casting a spell. If the spell is 3rd level or lower, it fails and has no effect. If the spell is 4th level or higher, Jon Irenicus makes an Intelligence check (DC 10 + the spell's level). On a success, the spell fails and has no effect. Whatever the spell's level, the caster takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage if the spell fails.

actions.name: Drain Life (1/Day)
actions.text: Jon Irenicus makes a drain life attack with his rod of lordly might. If he hits a creature with his rod, the creature must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes an extra 14 (4d6) necrotic damage, and Jon regains a number of hit points equal to half that necrotic damage.

actions.name: Paralyze (1/Day)
actions.text: Jon Irenicus makes a paralyze attack with his rod of lordly might. If he hits a creature with his rod, the creature must make a DC 17 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has the paralyzed condition for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Jon Irenicus uses Spellcasting.

actions.name: Transformation (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: Jon Irenicus becomes endowed with endurance and martial prowess for 1 minute or until he ends this effect by using a bonus action. While transformed, he gains 50 temporary hit points, proficiency in Strength and Constitution saving throw, adds his Multiattack feature, and loses his Draining Counterspell reaction and Spellcasting action.

When the period of unconsciousness ends, the creature transforms into a mind flayer (see the Monster Manual) with all its hit points. special.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 22, each creature in a 90-foot-long, 10-foot-wide Line. Failure: 67 (15d8) Acid damage. Success: Half damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 21, +13 to hit with spell attacks): At will: Detect Magic, Fear, Melf's Acid Arrow (level 4 version) 1/day each: Create Undead, Speak with Dead, Vitriolic Sphere (level 5 version)

actions.name: Cloud of Insects
actions.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 21, one creature the dragon can see within 120 feet. Failure: 33 (6d10) Poison damage, and the target has Disadvantage on saving throws to maintain Concentration until the end of its next turn. Failure or Success: The dragon can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.text: The dragon uses Spellcasting to cast Fear. The dragon can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Pounce
actions.text: The dragon moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one Rend attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 21, +13 to hit with spell attacks):

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The dragon can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Stygian Wasting
traits.text: Creatures afflicted with this disease are incapable of regaining hit points in any way until the disease is cured. Additionally, as their flesh starts to rot, a creature with this disease takes 36 (8d8) necrotic damage after each long rest they finish.

traits.name: Styx Dweller
traits.text: The dragon is immune to all negative effects from the River Styx.

multiAttack.text: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks using its Bite, Tail, or a combination of the two. It can replace one of the attacks with Constrict.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d10 + 8) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage, and the target must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target contracts Stygian Wasting.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 22). The dragon can't make a Tail attack while a creature is grappled in this way.

special.name: Constrict
special.text: The dragon tightens its grip on a creature grappled by its tail. The creature takes 27 (3d12 + 8) bludgeoning damage, has the restrained condition until the start of the dragon's next turn, and must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target contracts Stygian Wasting.

special.name: Frightful Presence
special.text: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or have the frightened condition for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

special.name: Stygian Breath
special.text: The dragon exhales poisonous Styx water in a 60-foot-long, 10-foot-wide line. Each creature in that line must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Creatures that fail the save contract Stygian Wasting.

actions.name: Detect
actions.text: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

actions.name: Tail Attack
actions.text: The dragon makes a Tail attack. If a creature is already grappled, the dragon may use Constrict instead.

actions.name: Death Throw (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: If the dragon has successfully restrained a creature with the Constrict ability, it may throw them up to 100 feet away. When it lands, the creature takes 21 (6d6) bludgeoning damage and must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has the unconscious condition for 10 minutes.

traits.name: Alert
traits.text: The giant can't be surprised, and it has advantage on initiative rolls.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The giant can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the giant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Scrying (Requires Storm Rune)
traits.text: The giant can use its crystal ball to cast the scrying spell (save DC 17).

traits.name: Storm Rune
traits.text: The giant has a storm rune inscribed on a crystal ball. While the object bearing the rune is embedded in its body, the giant can use its Tempest Call action and its Scrying trait.

multiAttack.text: The giant makes three Lightning Blade or Lightning Lance attacks.

attacks.name: Lightning Blade
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d8 + 9) slashing damage plus 16 (3d10) lightning damage.

attacks.name: Lightning Lance
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +13 to hit, range 500 ft., one target. Hit: 39 (5d12 + 7) lightning damage.

special.name: Tempest Call (Requires Storm Rune)
special.text: The giant creates an elemental vortex that fills a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area other than the giant must make a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 43 (8d8 + 7) damage of a type of the giant's choosing: cold, lightning, or thunder. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The giant casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 21, +13 to hit with spell attacks): At will: detect magic, detect thoughts 1/day each: control water, control weather (as an action), dispel magic, plane shift, sending, time stop

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 21, +13 to hit with spell attacks):

traits.name: Diabolical Restoration
traits.text: If the pit fiend dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Nine Hells.

traits.name: Fear Aura
traits.text: The pit fiend emanates an aura in a 20-foot Emanation while it doesn't have the Incapacitated condition. Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 21, any enemy that starts its turn in the aura. Failure: The target has the Frightened condition until the start of its next turn. Success: The target is immune to this pit fiend's aura for 24 hours.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.text: If the pit fiend fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The pit fiend has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The pit fiend makes one Bite attack, two Devilish Claw attacks, and one Fiery Mace attack.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +14, reach 10 ft. Hit: 18 (3d6 + 8) Piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must make the following saving throw. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 21. Failure: The target has the Poisoned condition. While Poisoned, the target can't regain Hit Points and takes 21 (6d6) Poison damage at the start of each of its turns, and it repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

attacks.name: Devilish Claw
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +14, reach 10 ft. Hit: 26 (4d8 + 8) Necrotic damage.

attacks.name: Fiery Mace
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +14, reach 10 ft. Hit: 22 (4d6 + 8) Force damage plus 21 (6d6) Fire damage.

special.name: Hellfire Spellcasting (Recharge 4–6)
special.text: The pit fiend casts Fireball (level 5 version) twice, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 21). It can replace one Fireball with Hold Monster (level 7 version) or Wall of Fire.

spellcasting.name: Hellfire Spellcasting (Recharge 4–6)
headerEntries: The pit fiend casts Fireball (level 5 version) twice, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 21). It can replace one Fireball with Hold Monster (level 7 version) or Wall of Fire.

traits.name: Annihilating Aura
traits.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the nightwalker must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or take 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. Undead are immune to this aura.

traits.name: Life Eater
traits.text: A creature dies if reduced to 0 hit points by the nightwalker and can't be revived except by a wish spell.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The nightwalker doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

multiAttack.text: The nightwalker makes two Enervating Focus attacks, one of which can be replaced by Finger of Doom, if available.

attacks.name: Enervating Focus
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (5d8 + 6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

special.name: Finger of Doom
special.text: The nightwalker points at one creature it can see within 300 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw or take 39 (6d12) necrotic damage and become frightened until the end of the nightwalker's next turn. While frightened in this way, the creature is also paralyzed. If a target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the nightwalker's Finger of Doom for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the leviathan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Partial Freeze
traits.text: If the leviathan takes 50 cold damage or more during a single turn, the leviathan partially freezes; until the end of its next turn, its speeds are reduced to 20 feet, and it makes attack rolls with disadvantage.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The leviathan deals double damage to objects and structures.

traits.name: Water Form
traits.text: The leviathan can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

multiAttack.text: The leviathan makes one Slam attack and one Tail attack.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (2d12 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (2d12) acid damage.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) acid damage.

special.name: Tidal Wave
special.text: The leviathan magically creates a wave of water that extends from a point it can see within 120 feet of itself. The wave is up to 250 feet long, up to 250 feet tall, and up to 50 feet wide. Each creature in the wave must make a DC 24 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 45 (7d12) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. The water spreads out across the ground in all directions, extinguishing unprotected flames in its area and within 250 feet of it, and then it vanishes.

actions.name: Move
actions.text: The leviathan moves up to its speed.

actions.name: Slam (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: The leviathan makes one Slam attack.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The kolyarut is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.text: If the kolyarut fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The kolyarut has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The kolyarut makes four Unerring Blade attacks.

attacks.name: Unerring Blade
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: automatic hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 24 force damage plus one of the following effects (choose one or roll a d6):

special.name: Edict of Blades
special.text: The kolyarut moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and can make one Unerring Blade attack against each creature it moves past. Whenever it hits a creature with an Unerring Blade attack during this movement, each spell of 5th level or lower on the creature ends, and the creature has the incapacitated condition until the end of the kolyarut's next turn.

special.name: Plane Shift (3/Day)
special.text: The kolyarut casts plane shift, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. The kolyarut can cast the spell normally, or it can cast the spell on an unwilling creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. If it uses the latter option, the targeted creature must succeed on a DC 18 Charisma saving throw or be sent to a teleportation circle in the Hall of Concordance in Sigil.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.text: The kolyarut adds 6 to its AC against one attack roll that would hit it. To do so, the kolyarut must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the champion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

multiAttack.text: The champion makes four Blazing Morningstar attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with Blade Storm, if available.

attacks.name: Blazing Morningstar
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage.

special.name: Blade Storm
special.text: The champion conjures a churning storm of spectral blades that fills a 20-foot cube centered on a point it can see within 120 feet of itself. The storm lasts until the start of the champion's next turn. While the storm is active, the area of the storm is difficult terrain. Whenever a creature enters the storm for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) slashing damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Furious Pursuit
actions.text: The champion moves up to its speed or commands its mount to move up to its speed. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

actions.name: Induce Violence
actions.text: The champion targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or immediately make one melee weapon attack against another creature of the champion's choice that is within the target's reach. If no creature is within the target's reach or if the target has the incapacitated condition, the target instead takes 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

actions.name: Menace (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: The champion chooses any number of creatures it can see within 30 feet of itself. Each target must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or have the frightened condition until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Spell-Resistant Carapace
traits.text: The gigant has advantage on saving throws against spells, and any creature that makes a spell attack against the gigant has disadvantage on the attack roll.

multiAttack.text: The gigant makes one Mandibles attack and two Talons attacks.

attacks.name: Mandibles
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 21 (4d6 + 7) slashing damage, and the target has the grappled condition (escape DC 17). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 21 (4d6 + 7) slashing damage at the start of each of the gigant's turns. While the gigant is grappling a target, it can't use Mandibles against other targets.

attacks.name: Talons
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) slashing damage, and the target is pulled 10 feet straight toward the gigant.

special.name: Scale Dust
special.text: The gigant releases magical dust from its wings in a 30-foot cube. Each creature in that area must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a success or failure, the creature has the poisoned condition for 1 hour. While poisoned this way, the creature can't regain hit points.

bonusActions.name: Drone
bonusActions.text: The gigant produces a horrid droning sound by rapidly beating its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the gigant must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (3d6) thunder damage and have the incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn. The gigant can then fly up to half its flying speed.

traits.name: Berserk
traits.text: If the core inside the colossus is destroyed, the colossus goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the colossus attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the colossus attacks an object. Once the colossus goes berserk, it remains berserk until it is destroyed.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The colossus is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The colossus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

multiAttack.text: The colossus makes two Fist attacks.

attacks.name: Fist
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit (with advantage if the colossus is berserk), reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is pulled up to 15 feet toward the colossus, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 17), and it has the restrained condition until this grapple ends. The colossus can have up to two creatures grappled this way at a time.

special.name: Elemental Breath
special.text: The colossus exhales a cloud swirling with elemental energy in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 40 (9d8) damage of a type of the colossus's choosing: acid, cold, fire, or lightning. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage. At the same time as the colossus releases this exhalation, creatures inside the colossus's chest cavity take 40 (9d8) force damage from churning elemental energy.

bonusActions.name: Bite
bonusActions.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Large or smaller creature grappled by the colossus. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage, and the creature is swallowed. A swallowed creature has the restrained condition, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the colossus, and takes 10 (3d6) force damage at the start of each of the colossus's turns.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.text: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.text: The drow wields a tentacle rod.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

multiAttack.text: The drow makes two Demon Staff attacks or one Demon Staff attack and three Tentacle Rod attacks.

attacks.name: Demon Staff
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 14 (4d6) psychic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the drow for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

attacks.name: Tentacle Rod
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is hit three times by the tentacle rod on one turn, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer the following effects for 1 minute: the target's speed is halved, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. Moreover, on each of its turns, it can take either an action or a bonus action, but not both. At the end of each of its turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

special.name: Divine Flame (2/Day)
special.text: A 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high column of divine fire sprouts in an area up to 120 feet away from the drow. Each creature in the column must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) fire damage and 14 (4d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20): At will: command, dancing lights, detect magic, thaumaturgy 2/day each: banishment, blade barrier, cure wounds, hold person, plane shift, silence 1/day each: clairvoyance, darkness, detect thoughts, dispel magic, faerie fire, gate, levitate (self only), suggestion

bonusActions.name: Lolth's Fickle Favor
bonusActions.text: The drow bestows the Spider Queen's blessing on one ally she can see within 30 feet of her. The ally takes 7 (2d6) psychic damage but has advantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

bonusActions.name: Summon Servant (1/Day)
bonusActions.text: The drow magically summons a glabrezu or a yochlol. The summoned creature appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

actions.name: Compel Demon
actions.text: An allied demon within 30 feet of the drow uses its reaction to make one attack against a target of the drow's choice that she can see.

actions.name: Demon Staff
actions.text: The drow makes one Demon Staff attack.

actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: The drow uses Spellcasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20):

traits.name: Assassinate
traits.text: During its first turn, the slayer has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the slayer scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the slayer's darkvision.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The slayer is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form, except for its Ravager Form ability.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.text: If the slayer fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The slayer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The slayer's claw attacks are magical.

multiAttack.text: The slayer makes four Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The target dies if this attack reduces its hit point maximum to 0. The reduction lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

bonusActions.name: Prey
bonusActions.text: The slayer focuses on a single creature it can see within 60 feet. Afterwards, the first time each turn that the slayer hits that creature, the slayer does an additional 7 (2d6) damage.

actions.name: Savage Disengage
actions.text: The slayer disengages without provoking opportunity attacks. If it moves within 5 feet of a creature it makes a Claw attack against the creature.

actions.name: Finish (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: The slayer attacks a creature that has been marked by its Prey ability. If this attack hits and the creature has less than 40 hit points remaining after the attack, the creature is reduced to 0 hit points.

actions.name: Ravager Form (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: If the slayer has killed a creature of CR/level 5 or greater that it previously marked with its Prey ability in the last minute, it can transform into its ravager form. The form lasts until dawn (minimum 1 hour).

traits.name: Animal Lordship
traits.text: An animal lord represents a Forager, Hunter, or Sage (DM's choice), which determines certain traits in this stat block.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.text: If the animal lord fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Lordly Presence
traits.description: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 20, any enemy that starts its turn in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the animal lord. Failure: The target suffers one of the following effects:

options.name: Captivated (Forager Only)
options.text: The target has the Charmed condition until the end of its next turn. While Charmed, the target has the Incapacitated condition.

options.name: Fearful (Hunter Only)
options.text: The target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn.

options.name: Mired (Sage Only)
options.text: The target takes 10 (3d6) Psychic damage, and the target is magically bewildered until the end of its next turn. While bewildered, the target subtracts 1d4 from its saving throws.

traits.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 20, any enemy that starts its turn in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the animal lord. Failure: The target suffers one of the following effects:

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The animal lord has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The animal lord makes two attacks, using Rend or Radiant Ray in any combination, and uses Animal Spirit.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +13, reach 5 ft. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) Force damage.

attacks.name: Radiant Ray
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +12, range 120 ft. Hit: 20 (4d6 + 6) Radiant damage.

special.name: Animal Spirit
special.description: The animal lord conjures an animal spirit that strikes at a creature and then disappears. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 20, one creature the animal lord can see within 120 feet. Failure: 28 (4d10 + 6) Radiant damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: One of the following effects occurs:

options.name: Fortify (Forager Only)
options.text: The animal lord gains 20 Temporary Hit Points.

options.name: Marked as Prey (Hunter Only)
options.text: The animal lord has Advantage on attack rolls against the target until the start of the animal lord's next turn.

options.name: Pesky Swarm (Sage Only)
options.text: The target has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

special.text: The animal lord conjures an animal spirit that strikes at a creature and then disappears. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 20, one creature the animal lord can see within 120 feet. Failure: 28 (4d10 + 6) Radiant damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: One of the following effects occurs:

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The animal lord casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20): At will: Animal Friendship, Animal Messenger, Speak with Animals 2/day each: Awaken, Greater Restoration 1/day each: Animal Shapes, Sunburst

bonusActions.name: Shape-Shift
bonusActions.text: The animal lord shape-shifts into a Huge or smaller version of the animal it represents or a Medium or Small Humanoid, or it returns to its true form. Its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

actions.name: Feral Strike
actions.text: The animal lord moves up to its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks, and it makes one Rend attack.

actions.name: Radiant Strike
actions.text: The animal lord makes one Radiant Ray attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The animal lord casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20):

traits.name: Ice Walk
traits.text: The dragon can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, Difficult Terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day, or 5/Day in Lair)
traits.text: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

multiAttack.text: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +14, reach 15 ft. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) Cold damage.

special.name: Cold Breath
special.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 22, each creature in a 90-foot Cone. Failure: 63 (14d8) Cold damage. Success: Half damage.

actions.name: Freezing Burst
actions.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 20, each creature in a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the dragon can see within 120 feet. Failure: 14 (4d6) Cold damage, and the target's Speed is 0 until the end of the target's next turn. Failure or Success: The dragon can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Pounce
actions.text: The dragon moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one Rend attack.

spellcasting.name: Frightful Presence
